title: Systematic Science Program Effectiveness Analysis and Instructional Design Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of science education and elementary knowledge of learning theories
context.additional_context: Classroom environment enabling the use of digital devices as supplementary materials. Curriculum linked to social studies vocational fields

learning_goals: Identify core components of a systematic science program (inquiry activities, scientific discourse) with over 80% accuracy
Propose at least three science lesson design strategies tailored to diverse learners, including those with learning disabilities
Analyze at least two conditions for applying effective science teaching methods based on research findings

Learners analyze three real-world science lesson cases within a week and propose improvement plans that meet at least four of the five core indicators of the evaluation framework (goal clarity, activity diversity, assessment fairness, etc.).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
